There is only a previously installed SSH client, and *NOT* a server.
Here are the commands for starting and shutting it down.
Start: "sudo invoke-rc.d ssh start" Stop: "sudo invoke-rc.d ssh stop"
isn't this like more of a redhat format? Like in debian you only start it with "sshd"
No, sshd is just a "daemon" that runs in the background.
the command I gave you is the Debian style. In Red Hat  you would have used something called "chkconfig"
